title: Question 9
prompt:
Sentence 1: Recycling has increased from less than 10% of household waste in 1980 to over 30%, but America still has a problem with waste.

The most effective revision of sentence 1 would begin with which group of words?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The sentence is two independent clauses joined by a comma and the conjunction “but.” “Recyling has increased from less than 10% of household waste in 1980 to over 30%” is an independent clause because it could be a sentence by itself. “America still has a problem with waste” is also an independent clause. One way to change this sentence is by making one of the independent clauses into a subordinate, or dependant, clause by adding a subordinating conjunction, such as “Although,” and deleting the conjunction. The revised sentence reads: “Although recycling has increased from less than 10% of household waste in 1980 to over 30%, America still has a problem with waste.”
